awd_titl_txt: EAGER: BPCnet: A Broadening Participation Resource Portal
awd_abstract_narration:
The Computing Research Association (CRA) proposes to build a website, called the"BPCNet Resource Portal" to be hosted at CRA. BPCNet will support and amplify the efforts that the Computer and Information Systems and Engineering (CISE) Directorate at the National Science Foundation (NSF) has recently undertaken to engage more of its Principal Investigators (PIs) in broadening participation in computing (BPC) activities.

The BPCNet Resource Portal will provide resources for CISE PIs, allowing them to search for best and promising practices in BPC. More importantly, it will allow them to find and connect to collective impact efforts by providing exemplars of (1) departmental BPC plans, and (2) scaffolding that lets CISE PIs participate in existing Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) and BPC programs run by a range of organizations. CRA will participate in a series of workshops to further plan the role of the website and obtain feedback on its design and deployment. It will convene two committees to maintain and curate the portal: an Evaluation Committee that includes representatives of the Center for Evaluating the Research Pipeline (CERP) and the National Center for Women and Information Technology (NCWIT); a Steering Committee that includes CRA Board members and committee members from its Subcommittee on the Status of Women in Computing Research (CRA-W), and representatives of diversity-oriented organizations, that will guide the direction of the portal and interface with the community. Finally, CRA's reach and its convening role in the community will make this resource visible, leverage its staff and Committees for curation, and exploit its existing dissemination avenues.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
The paramount initiative of this project was the development of the Broadening Participation in Computing NETwork (BPCNet) Resource Portal. The BPCNet Resource Portal supports and amplifies new and existing efforts of the Computer and Information Systems and Engineering (CISE) Directorate at the National Science Foundation (NSF) to engage more of its Principal Investigators (PIs) in broadening participation in computing (BPC) activities. The objectives of the project  included increasing the visibility of ongoing broadening participation efforts and community awareness of these efforts; and, (2) assisting NSF PIs in planning meaningful Broader Impact components of their proposals. 

The Intellectual Merit of the project focuses on providing a much-needed clearinghouse for the community to learn about and engage with ongoing projects to diversify computing. The BPCNet Resource Portal provides resources for CISE PIs, allowing them to search for best and promising practices in BPC. Importantly, it enables them to find and connect with collective impact efforts by providing exemplars of (1) departmental BPC plans, and (2) NSF-supported scaffolding that lets CISE PIs participate in existing Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) and BPC programs run by a range of private organizations. CRA?s reach and its convening role in the community was instrumental in making this resource visible, leveraging its staff and committees for curation, and utilizing its existing dissemination avenues. Additionally, CRA?s Center for Evaluating the Research Pipeline provided vital support by leading a series of community workshops to develop BPC departmental plans supporting participating institutions with their efforts to strengthen the research pipeline.

The Broader Impacts of the project was to harness the large number of NSF CISE PIs to make a real and measurable difference in broadening participation in computing. The BPCnet Resource Portal is a well-publicized resource that also enhances the success and reach of existing broadening participation programs, particularly those funded by NSF such as the BPC Alliances.

In the final year, the project funded attendance of chairs from minority-serving institutions (MSIs) to participate in a panel at the Snowbird 2022 Conference, the bi-annual CRA event that draws department chairs from across its membership.  The purpose of the MSI panel was to create awareness of opportunities and challenges in working with MSIs among Snowbird attendees.


 

 


Last Modified: 06/06/2023
Modified by: Erik C Russell
